perturbation.original_text: MAINTENANCE OF SOLVENCY. This provision applies only to benefits provided through the General Account. If the solvency of the Society becomes impaired, you may be required to make an extra payment. The Board of Directors will determine the amount of any extra payment. It will be based on each member's fair share of the deficiency. You may make the extra payment by an equivalent reduction in benefits or by a payment in cash. If you do not make the extra payment within 60 days from the date we notify you of your share of the deficiency, the amount will be charged as an indebtedness against the contract with interest compounded at the rate of 5% per year.
perturbation.changed_text: MAINTENANCE OF SOLVENCY. This provision applies only to benefits provided through the General Account. If the solvency of the Society becomes impaired, you may be required to make an extra payment. The Board of Directors will determine the amount of any extra payment. It will be based on criteria they deem appropriate. You may make the extra payment by an equivalent reduction in benefits or by a payment in cash. If you do not make the extra payment, the amount will be charged as an indebtedness against the contract.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies the extra payment will be 'based on each member's fair share of the deficiency' and that interest will be 'compounded at the rate of 5% per year'. The changed text removes these specifics, creating uncertainty about how the extra payment is calculated and how interest will accrue. The definition of how it is calculate conflicts between the sections.

perturbation.original_text: DIVIDENDS. Each year, we will determine our divisible surplus. This contract's share, if any, will be credited as a dividend. Since we do not expect this contract to contribute to divisible surplus, it is not expected that any dividends will be credited.
perturbation.changed_text: DIVIDENDS. Each year, we will determine our divisible surplus. This contract's share may be credited as a dividend. Dividends may be credited based on board discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that dividends are not expected because the contract is not expected to contribute to divisible surplus. The changed text introduces ambiguity by stating dividends 'may' be credited, contradicting the original expectation of no dividends. This creates an inconsistency about dividend eligibility.

perturbation.original_text:
ENTIRE CONTRACT

In the ENTIRE CONTRACT section, the first phrase and numbered list are amended to read:

The Entire Contract consists of: 1) This contract including any attached riders, amendments, or endorsements; 2) The Application attached to this contract; and 3) The Articles of Incorporation and Bylaws of the Society and all amendments to them. Benefits will not be reduced or eliminated by any future amendments to our Articles of Incorporation or Bylaws.
perturbation.changed_text:
ENTIRE CONTRACT

In the ENTIRE CONTRACT section, the first phrase and numbered list are amended to read:

The Entire Contract consists of: 1) This contract including any attached riders, amendments, or endorsements; 2) The Application attached to this contract; and 3) The Articles of Incorporation and Bylaws of the Society. Benefits will not be reduced or eliminated by any amendments to our Articles of Incorporation or Bylaws.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies 'all amendments to them', where as the changed text only says 'The Articles of Incorporation and Bylaws of the Society' which creates an omission of current and future amendments that could apply. This could create uncertainty in enforcement by making it unclear whether future changes to the bylaws are part of the contract.
